oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Show: Moe Bandy - 1982-05-18 - Reel 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recordings are of the Ralph Emery Show. The show is hosted by Ralph Emery (entertainer), and features Emery in discussion with his guest: Moe Bandy (musician). The show was recorded on May 18, 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Moe Bandy; Ralph Emery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Moe Bandy performs a radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:13) Ralph Emery introduces Bandy -- (01:01) Bandy praises Johnny Gimble's humor while discussing ""Home in San Antone"" -- (02:12) Emery asserts that Bandy should record with the Kendalls; additionally, the subject of 'cheating songs' are discussed -- (03:19) Bandy reflects on the inspiration for ""She's Not Really Cheatin', She's Gettin' Even"" -- (04:07) Emery discusses Bandy's provocative album cover, and both Emery and Bandy discuss Bandy's conservatism -- (07:46) Emery asks Bandy to reflect on ""Someday Soon"" as a departure, and Bandy's connection to the rodeo -- (12:59) Bandy recalls working a show with Janie Fricke while discussing ""Don't Worry About Me Baby"" -- (14:53) Emery has Bandy reflect on the General Lee -- (15:30) Bandy reflects on his favorite line from ""Rodeo Romeo"" -- (16:32) Emery and Bandy say their goodbyes -- (16:54) Emery introduces Bandy to discuss Dolly Parton's ""Heartbreak Express"" -- (17:29) Emery asks Bandy to reflect on his working career for Braniff International Airways and Mel Tillis -- (19:33) Emery inquires as to what Bandy begins his shows with -- (19:58) Emery discusses the accolades of Ricky Skaggs -- (20:39) Emery inquires about the whereabouts of Joe Stampley -- (22:53) Emery asks Bandy to reflect on being named Country Music Duo of the Year, and Bandy's involvement with a club -- (25:28) Emery inquires to what Bandy would do if he met a man from Mars; additionally, Bandy's pronunciation of ""My Woman Loves the Devil Out of Me"" is discussed -- (28:35) Lacy J. Dalton is praised by Bandy and Emery -- (29:00) Emery inquires as to Bandy's work with Conway Twitty, and Emery asks Bandy how he can contact him -- (31:24) Emery asks Bandy about his plans with his beard -- (32:32) Emery and Bandy say their goodbyes -- (32:51) Emery introduces Bandy -- (33:26) Emery recalls doing an episode of Alabama and Friends while discussing Alabama -- (34:53) Emery asks Bandy to discuss ""The Champ,"" and his drinking habits -- (35:36) Emery and Bandy discuss Bandy's first appearance on the Ralph Emery Show -- (38:15) Emery and Bandy discuss the misconception of ""Jesus in a Nashville Jail"" -- (40:30) Bandy performs a disc jockey role when he introduces ""Dreamin'"" -- (42:00) Emery recalls how Minnie Pearl was told how to change country music -- (42:22) Bandy introduces ""She's Not Really Cheatin', She's Gettin' Even"" -- (43:15) Emery recalls how the first interview of Bandy featured his father's rodeo -- (45:30) Emery and Bandy reflect on the power of Willie Nelson while discussing ""Old Friends"" -- (46:48) Emery and Bandy discuss performing at a drive-in theatre -- (48:38) Bandy and Emery say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Bandy, Moe;
